{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"image","attrs":{"src":"/brilliantexport/solvable/98a8dca25a.0374c9016a.uSSu86.gif"}},{"type":"text","text":"
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\begin{cases} x^3-6x^2+5x=0 \\  2x^4-11x^3+23x^2-99x+45=0 \end{cases}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"If "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"A"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" satisfy the root that satisfy the system of equations above? What is the value of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1700^{\log_{A}17}-17^{\log_A1700} "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"?"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"heading","attrs":[{"level":6}],"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Join the Brilliant Classes and enjoy the excellence."}]}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            Actually, we don't need to find the roots at all because "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"{ x }^{ \log _{ y }{ z }  }={ z }^{ \log _{ y }{ x }  }\quad always\quad :\quad )"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            Ya definitely I will 
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Let\quad { a }^{ \log _{ b }{ c }  }\quad and\quad { c }^{ \log _{ b }{ a }  }\quad be\quad the\quad two\quad to\quad be\quad proved\quad equal.\\ If\quad { b }^{ m }\quad =\quad c\quad ,\quad { a }^{ \log _{ b }{ c }  }={ \quad a }^{ m }\quad (eqn\quad 1)\\ If\quad { b }^{ n }\quad =\quad a\quad ,\quad { c }^{ \log _{ b }{ a }  }\quad =c^{ n }\quad (eqn\quad 2)\\ Now,\quad b\quad ={ \quad c }^{ \frac { 1 }{ m }  }={ \quad a }^{ \frac { 1 }{ n }  }.Therefore\\ { c }^{ n }={ a }^{ m }.\quad This\quad proves\quad (eqn\quad 1)\quad =\quad (eqn\quad 2)\\ So,\quad { a }^{ \log _{ b }{ c }  }\quad =\quad { c }^{ \log _{ b }{ a }  }\quad .\quad \sharp \sharp \sharp  "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" 
Enjoy!

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"No matter the base, we always have:
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a^{\log b}=b^{\log a}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
Proof: Writing "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"e"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" for the base (though it really could be anything), it's easy to see that they are both equal to "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"e^{(\log a)(\log b)}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\quad\square"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"This immediately gives us "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1700^{\log_A17}=17^{\log_A1700}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", which means that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\boxed{1700^{\log_A17}-17^{\log_A1700}=0}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"As mentioned by another solution, it can be shown that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x^{\log_y z} = z^{\log_y x}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", so you don't even need any other information to know the result is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"0"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"That said, if you did want to find the roots as an exercise, then I'd recommend starting with "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x^3 - 6x^2 + 5x =  x(x-5)(x-1) = 0"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". Since the constant term of the second equation is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"45"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", it's worth verifying that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x-5"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is a root. Once you discover that it is, you can factor out the rest: "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2x^4 - 11x^3 + 23x^2 - 99x + 45 = (x-5)(2x-1)(x^2+9) = 0"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\begin{aligned} abc+ab+bc+ca+a+b+c&=&1\\ bcd+bc+cd+db+b+c+d&=&7 \\ cda+cd+da+ac+c+d+a&=&2\\ dab+da+ab+bd+d+a+b&=&9 \end{aligned} "}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
There exists a monic quartic polynomial with  non-real roots "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a,b,c,d"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". Compute its discriminant."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"horizontalRule"},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"heading","attrs":[{"level":6}],"content":[{"type":"text","text":"This is a sequel to this problem."}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"add one to each eqns to find:
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(a+1)(b+1)(c+1)=2"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(b+1)(c+1)(d+1)=8"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(c+1)(d+1)(a+1)=3"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(d+1)(a+1)(b+1)=10"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
let A=a+1,B=b+1,C=c+1,D=d+1. then
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"ABC=2,BCD=8,CDA=3,DAB=10"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
multiply all to get
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(ABCD)^3=2*8*3*10=480"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
subtract each eqn simultaneously :
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\begin{cases}
(A-D)BC=2-8=-6\\
(A-C)BD=10-8=2\\
(A-B)CD=3-8=-5\\
(B-C)AD=10-3=7\\
(B-D)AC=2-3=-1\\
(D-C)AB=10-2=8
\end{cases}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
multiply all these to get
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(A-B)(A-C)(A-D)(B-C)(B-D)(D-C)(ABCD)^3=-3360"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(A-B)(A-C)(A-D)(B-C)(B-D)(D-C)=-7"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\Delta=((a-b)(a-c)(a-d)(b-c)(b-d)(d-c))^2=\boxed{49}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}
